Returns: Whether the event is from the given source.
Parameters: int: The input source to check against. This can be a specific device type, such as @B_android#view#InputDevice#SOURCE_TOUCH_NAVIGATION_E@, or a more generic device class, such as @B_android#view#InputDevice#SOURCE_CLASS_POINTER_E@.
isFromSource(int).Description: Determines whether the event is from the given source.

getFuzz().Description: Gets the error tolerance for input device measurements with respect to this axis. For example, a value of 2 indicates that the measured value may be up to +/- 2 units away from the actual value due to noise and device sensitivity limitations.

Returns: The extent of the center flat position.
getFlat().Description: Gets the extent of the center flat position with respect to this axis. For example, a flat value of 8 means that the center position is between -8 and +8. This value is mainly useful for calibrating self-centering devices.

getSource().Description: Gets the source for which the axis is defined.

getRange().Description: Gets the range of the axis (difference between maximum and minimum).

getMax().Description: Gets the inclusive maximum value for the axis.

getMin().Description: Gets the inclusive minimum value for the axis.

Returns: The resolution in units per millimeter, or units per radian for rotational axes.
getResolution().Description: Gets the resolution for input device measurements with respect to this axis.
